page.description: Create a query from the current range, if one is in effect - returns .T. if new query created.
page.original:
&ltTBL>.QUERY_FROM_RANGE() Syntax Result_Flag as L = &ltTBL>.QUERY_FROM_RANGE() Description The &ltTBL>.QUERY_FROM_RANGE() method converts the current range into a query. A query is static, whereas a range is dynamic. You might want to convert a range to a query so as to get a count of the number of records in a range, or to prevent the range of records from changing dynamically. Result_Flag is .T. if the query was successfully created (i.e. a range was in effect), and is .F. if the query was not created (i.e. there was no range in effect). Example Assume that the user has set a range using the Lastname index and selected a first key of "Higgins" and a last key of "Jones" This script is attached to a button on a form. It displays a count of the records in the range. parentform:Tables:Customer.Query_From_Range() qry_ptr = parentform:Tables:Customer.Index_Primary_Get() rec_count = qry_ptr.records_get() ui_msg_box("Records in query","Range has " + str(rec_count) + " records")
See Also Table Functions and Methods, Query Functions and Methods
